caption: The best breakfast sandwiches and everyone is always so pleasant. I literally dream about the golden one.
Staff was underwhelming but coffee was good.
Great coffee and some really delicious prepared foods - the matzo ball soup is soooo good!
Delicious coffee, food, and friendly folks
Nice backyard, great coffee but no flavors if you're looking for that. Really overpriced breakfast sandwiches that are tasty. Always great service!
My favorite spot in the neighborhood! I crave these breakfast sandwiches, coffee is always great, and the staff is wonderful.
Super friendly staff, awesome sandwiches, great coffee.
**Ordered takeout during COVID pandemic  Food *The Golden One (Two Fried Eggs, Green Chile, Deer Creek Cheddar & Fried Potato Latke on Portuguese Bun) - Good *Halva Brownie - Good
Terrible service, online ordering is recommended yet it tells you a pick up time and then you have to wait another 20 minutes after that.

Decent overpriced food. Did not get to try the soup because for some reason they serve cold soup in a non-microwaveable container. The whole thing just melted in the microwave when tried to warm up. Thanks!
Delicious coconut macron 😋
Fire breakfast sandwiches. Not cheap but...

Mediocre customer service at best. This was my first time at Peck’s although I’ve been living in the neighborhood for 5 years. What a mistake. Not only was the staff (multiple people) rude to me, but also to my friend who I was with. I understand Covid has been a difficult time for small businesses, but hospitality was seriously lacking. Only giving 2 stars because the scone was good.
Their shakshuka breakfast sandwich is my go-to order. Although it’s expensive at $11. Glad this place is open again! Little dining garden out back.
Amazing cold brew and pastries + the breakfast sandwiches are great too. Most importantly, all the baristas and employees are always friendly and provide great service!

Coffee (flatwhite) was tasteless and lox sandwich greasy and average. Service inefficient and waitress insolent (busy flirting with the barista and obviously not caring about the line of customers. became snappy when asked to actually serve the coffee ordered online 30 mins ago)

Lived near Peck’s for 3 years and it has been my go-to for great coffee and food. Quaint backyard is perfect for remote work or meeting up with friends and their wide variety of sandwiches and baked goods never disappoint.
every time i come here the baristas are so kind & welcoming! love the coffee and the food, a neighborhood staple 😋
Old fashioned scrumptious baked goods and delicacies! It's the trendy neighborhood place to go!
Arguably the best breakfast sandwich in Brooklyn. They allow you to call ahead and order and the staff is always extremely polite. I always leave this place in a better mood than I arrived in.
Excellent service Great baked goods. Decent Coffee.
Good run-to coffee shop. They have lunch also!
Great coffee and luncheonette spot.

This place has the best chocolate chip cookie in Brooklyn.  I have tried almost every bakery in the greater north brooklyn area (park slope to Bushwick) and this place is tippy top. The breakfast sandwich experience is pleasant but the cookie is not to be missed
WOW. Hands down best coffee shop food I’ve ever had.
Great breakfast sandwich with Portuguese bread! The cappuccino was excellent too!
Most delectable 😋 a real local favorite 👍
One of the nest egg sandwiches of my life!!

(Translated by Google) One of the best bakery in the area, the coffee is very good, also growing ($ 3.5 anyway), excellent pastries and crispy baguette. The welcome is cordial without more. The place is a bit small to consume on the spot  (Original) Une des meilleures boulangerie du coin,  le café y est tres bon,  croissants aussi (3,5 $ quand meme),  les patisseries excellentes et la baguette croustillantes.  L'accueil est cordial sans plus.  L'endroit est un peu petit pour consommer sur place
Phenomenal breakfast sandwiches!
One of my favorites spot to take breakfast... Their hot cocoa is really good... The place and the staff are nice... Thank you
Excellent breakfast sandwich and friendly service!
If you need a sandwich and a beer and a coffee and something that isn't Thai food on Myrtle Avenue then this would be your jam.
Best breakfast sandwiches & pastries in Brooklyn!  The chocolate almond croissant is off the hook.  And great coffee, backyard, and beer selection - what more could you want!
Place charges you 50 cents for ice in an iced drink. As if they don't rob you enough on the price of coffee in general. Stay away from greedy coffee shops like this

Yummy variations on egg sandwiches, & a few other sandwiches. Good pastries. Tea coffee. Usually friendly service. Lovely backyard. Also a nice place to pick up good quality (slightly pricey) prepared food, bread, cheese, ice cream, & beer.
Delicious sandwiches for breakfast! Very friendly staff too. Spotted some great looking cakes and cheese as well.
Go here, get anything, enjoy your day. Great little shop.
Love this place.  Killer coffee and breakfast sandys.
Great place for Sunday morning.  Great pastries and sandwiches! A nice neighborhood feel.  Totally fine, you should go!
My favourite place on Myrtle for coffee, sandwiches and pastries. The deli is amazing too. ❤️
Love the coffee

The coffee is pricey but good. The atmosphere is nice, clean yet cozy. I love the window paintings they always change up. The food here is also pricey but I would say the coconut macaroons and cheese are worth the money. The cookies are too dry in my opinion tho.
Meh. Very limited food menu.
Really good coffee, high quality food and thoughtful service.

I love Pecks. They have an arsenal of fresh baked goods each morning from sandwiches to quiches to all the sweets you need. They serve made-to-order sandwiches for breakfast and lunch, including a basic bacon egg and cheese that is actually good because they actually use quality bacon, egg, cheese and bread. Great selection of beer and cider in the cans to go, the prepare a mean coffee (cold brew, espresso, lattemoccachinos... all that 😉) and, get this, they actually have a meat and cheese section and will slice you meats/cheeses like any other fancy meat and cheese shop. Though their selection of meat and cheese is small, it is in fact one of the most well-curated in the city. They will also preorder you whole hunks if you need for a big party. 10/10, spend your money here.
Stopped in quickly for a hot chocolate was great!
Amazing but overpriced. $19 for a rotisserie chicken. $15 - fine. $19 - come on, that chicken isn’t making me breakfast the next morning.

Great deli serving breakfast, sandwiches and a range of takeaway items. Highlights would have to be the rotisserie chicken and matzo ball soup. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE sort out your breakfast / lunch change over - 30/40 minutes with no sandwiches at 12-12:30, really !?!?!

Cool neighborhood spot for unique sandwiches (both breakfast and lunch), good coffee and craft beers. Go for breakfast and order the New Mexican Sandwich. Not much interior seating, so either check them out in the summer when you can sit in their backyard, or grab it to go.
Banana bread was good, but the hot chocolate was tasteless and poorly made
Delicious!

at first i was excited about this place but in recent months it has become so average, at best. giving 2 stars for the 2 food items that i enjoy: the farmers muffin and the shakshuka sandwich. oh and the backyard patio is nice.  otherwise, overpriced and overrated all around - a large iced coffee that is bland AF is $5 and their specialty drinks are made sloppily and not mixed properly, not to mention those only come in one size.  the entire staff is cold and bothered all the time, they act like it’s a burden and an annoyance when you simply place your order. i was literally sighed at and get an eye roll. as a business owner just down the street, the quality of the service is so terrible it doesn’t make up for the food given how many other better places there are around. highly disappointing.
Kyle made me a check with a letter explaining his situation, thank you. call me anytime you need me.
Our breakfast were great.  The staff was nice
yasss, this place is delicious. The cook is always late!
Great food and service!
Nice selection of overpriced foods and beverages. The service is so painfully slow that even if you're not in a hurry you're going to be annoyed. I try to only visit if I must.
Super tasty, love the eddies ego sammy

Staff are "semi tolerant" of customers at best. Corn muffin was dry and inedible. Iced latte was good, noticed small writing at the bottom of the posted menu that read additional charge of 50 cents for iced🙄

(Translated by Google) Good coffee and a pleasant terrace inside, as opposed to the somewhat impersonal customer service.  (Original) Buen café y una terraza agradable en su interior, por contra el trato hacia el cliente un tanto impersonal
Sandwiches so good! Cheese? Yes pleez! Beer!

I've never gone to Peck's, gotten a sandwich and left feeling like I could have put my money to better use. The prepared food here is honestly fantastic and since it's near my laundromat, it's given me a reason to rejoice when I'm in the neighborhood. There's a lovely backyard you can enjoy when it's nice out and they've also got WiFi.

Peck’s is one of the best coffee shops in the area. Excellent coffee and a good selection of pastries. Everything is freshly baked and prepared. They often have sessional pastries, and special foods for holidays. The baristas are friendly. They sell breakfast sandwiches and prepared food as well. Both are a little pricey, in my opinion, but the quality is worth the price.
Honestly, this is the best coffee on this section of Myrtle near Pratt Institute. They also have a nice selection of market goods along the side including La Colombe and Joe beans.

Great place . Attention to detail .outstanding sandwhich selection . Best Breakfast Sandwich on the block. Theo is doing it Right. Tasty fresh baked snacks to be had ...just had a pistachio and chocolate crossiant that was nothing short of incredible..pecks is a great  place to shop at .good things await you
Just amazing!!
Great food/drink. Friendly service.

I can't quite figure out if Peck's is a coffee shop or a little food market. There's virtually no seating inside, but they do have a spacious backyard that is perfect for the warmer months. The staff is neither friendly nor rude, but they do their job well. If you're into La Colombe coffee this place won't disappoint.

I've had their sandwiches and fresh made goods before and it's very good, but I ordered their pre packaged eggplant parm and asked it to be heated up today, it was barely luke warm and it tasted like it was sour or off. I wouldn't recommend anything pre packaged, stick to anything that's fresh off the menu.
Good coffee, breakfast sandwiches,  and charcuterie

A cozy, family-owned deli and bakery. The hot sandwich menu always has delicious options. But the highlight of this place are the pastries. Highly recommended for coffee and pastries. There's a back yard area which is great in the summers.
Delicious sandwiches and great (albeit expensive) craft beer selection. Lovely patio too!
Lovely outside garden patio. Tasty sandwiches. Quick and easy, although not necessarily cheap.
Try the Jewish Pope, and a k'nish.

Poor customer service. Bad food quality. If cook isn't there there isn't food. Cashier limits herself to cash and make coffee, very unhelpfull. Always carry attitude. When cook is there, he is willing to cook and help. Last time I went veggie sandwich was bad. Chicken without taste. Won't ever come back.

I bought a rosteried chiken here and it was horrible. Costumer service horrible, very unsupportive. they don't cut the chicken and it is $26. this chiken has not flavor at all, not sauce, and people that work here doesn't help we eat the chiken without sauce and they gave me 2 very small plates for a whole chiken.
Great food. Slow slow service
I go to Peck's at least three times a week during the school year. Theo and Kyle run a great shop. Make sure to check out the backyard!
Great sandwiches, snacks, pantry items and beer.

Awesome spot for baked goods, craft sandwiches, and provisions! Peck's has an awesome selection of Evil Twin and other brews, and the breakfast sandwiches are some of the best around. If they have the halva brownie, it's a must-try!
Great espresso, cold brew on tap, yum yum bakery treats
Great sandwiches, delicious baked goods and well curated assortment of grocery items.
THOSE BREAKFAST SANDWICHES!!! Great coffee also. And looks like a promising spot to get some interesting ingredients for the kitchen.

Peck's, when you're asked to make coffee drinks TO STAY, don't use PAPER CUPS! When you're asked many, many times to make it to stay, and you still grab a paper cup, times and again, you lose any credibility as a coffee shop. Not to mention the poor job you do with your espresso based drinks, and how insanely overpriced your shop is overall.
This place has coffee which is needed or else we get crabby. Cookies too pretty nice, not cheap tho.
Great baked goods, fresh salads and veggies to go, and great coffee.
$8 matzo ball soup wasn't even that good and had raw veggies in it. Not worth more than $2  Roasted chickens are solid
Delicious. Theo Peck is great.
Great food, great coffee, and great staff. This place is a must-try if you're in the area.
just got one of their roast chickens.  OMG  delicious.  cooked perfectly!!!
Great menu.
The folks at Peck's have more than your typical coffee/tea/craft beer/fancy provisions. Great spot for charcuterie, awesome prepared foods and friendly staff.

My favorite neighborhood coffee shop. We get the breakfast sandwich - without bread (gluten-free family) - all the time!  Great coffee, cheese , meat and deli counter. GREAT staff and service. Friendly, quick, and they remember our names and favorite drinks.
Yummy Latte!
Great place
Awesome pastry.. kitchen has gone down hill recently.
Im not a coffee connoisseur at all but I just got a regular coffee with almond milk  and it was amazing! Plus the baristas are all attractive. Always a plus
The best chocolate chip cookies, macaroons, and other savory treats. Also on the weekend the chocolate cinnamon babka roll is absolutely the best ever!
Superb establishment; delicious eats and warm staff. A real 'local'.
